content.description:
Start up either side of the large detached block in the center of the wall. At the top of the block clip a bolt to the right and make a tricky traverse up and over to a left facing corner crack. At the top of the corner crack, climb to the very top of the thin flake and clip another bolt. A few slab moves and a mantle get you onto a large ledge. Finish by climbing the overhanging crach above the cave.

Standard rack, 3 bolts, rap anchor.

Climb up the right hand side of a large flake past a lone bolt. Climb past a horizontal crack onto another smaller flake into a section of face climbing above protected by two bolts. This is the crux of the route and it can be avoided by climbing to the right of the bolts in the dark groove. The climb finishes above with some more face climbing and a layback finish protected by one final bolt and some gear.

The giant flake to the right of Peaceful Warrior.
Standard rack, 4 bolts

Start up either side of the large detached block in the center of the wall. At the top of the block continue straight up through broken cracks.  
  
 The crack that trends left at the top of block is another route called Peaceful Warrior. 
  
 Top seeps a tad after rain, a good novice lead.

The middle route on the Cabin Boys Office wall.
Standard rack, no bolts, rap anchor.

Balancy moves head up a series of bulges. First bolt is high and the moves to get there feel insecure (to me).

The bolt line to the right of the obvious finger crack (Zigidy Zag).
A few bolts. You could maybe put a small piece of gear between the 1st and 2nd bolts if you wanted.  Shares the anchor with Zigidy Zags - bolts with chains.

Fun moves out a nice finger crack lead to some thinner climbing and a crux at the finish. Start up either side of the large, detached block in the center of the wall. At the top of the block trend left, following a finger crack. Eventually the crack peters out, leaving a few moves of face before topping out. Begins at a detached block in the center of the wall. Trend left out a finger crack for Peaceful Warrior (.9). Taking the direct finish is Dugh! (.8). Pro to 2.5".

Bolted Anchor.

climbs.name: Way of the Wife
climbs.fa: Mike Duffy, Dave Gauley & Kristen Gauley. 1998.

content.description:
A nice mix of splitter fingers and technical face. Start up a left-leaning finger crack. Clip a bolt and move through a series of balancey overlaps to another short crack. A second bolt protects the finishing moves on the face. Look for the finger crack left of the wide gash in the middle of the crag. Pro to 1.5". Draws.

Bolted anchors.

climbs.name: Wet Dream
climbs.fa: Eric Hamel and Celine Gelinas in the 90s

content.description:
This is the long left facing open book on the far right side of the wall.  The crux comes in the last 30 feet with sustained fun jaming and chimneying in the flare.  I suspect the route has been recently cleaned and will grow over if it isn't climbed again.  Up top the rock is oddly chalky from all the water, but the pro is still good.   Great route.

Far right side of the wall.
Solid pro the whole way, despite appearances.  The crack up top is bigger than it looks and I was able to place cams of all sizes.   Bring a standard rack with all sizes of cams and nuts and you'll be fine.  I actually placed two #3 camalots (one at the dog leg and one higher up).

Finger cracks zig zag up to balancy face moves at a bolt.

Far left of the wall, finger crack noticeably zig zags.  Look for the lone bolt above.
Small gear, one bolt. Anchor with chains at the top.
A clean, west-facing crag offering a variety of traditional and mixed lines. The area has a bit of everything, including face, thin cracks, and some wideness.
